additional_notes: This is one of the more literate Doctor Who stories, with characters quoting Shakespeare and Shelley. The script includes some iambic pentameter. It's an ambitious project that highlights the possibilities for historical adventure. The story features a fine cast, including Julian Glover, marking the first flowering of Doctor Who's guest-star policy. Despite some misogyny, the script avoids racism and presents Arabic culture with integrity.
bottom_line: An ambitious project which highlights the possibilities for historical adventure. Imaginative, with a fine cast and a very adult storyline. Despite a dose of misogyny (with torture and beatings on-screen), the script manages to avoid racism, presenting Arabic culture with integrity.
